column4: Can anyone help me fix my Opera Browser? I installed it, and it worked fine for awile, but now I click on the icon and nothing happens
Can somone help me get a program working? It was working up until today, now it wont run
anybody lend a n00b a hand?
anyone help a n00b get a program working?
can somebody give me some help? My Opera web browser stopped working recently, it won't start.
can somone tell me how to fix it, or even how to just delete it so I can reinstall it?
did you install it with synaptic?
no, from the package on the website
opera
does it have you run an install script, or do you compile it?
it's already installed, I ran dpkg, if that tells you anything
I'm not entirely familier with all the linux terminology yet
oh, it's a dpkg package
no I just want to get it working again, it stopped working
what does it say if you try to run it from a command prompt
I feel like a huge n00b for asking this, but... how do you run it from the command prompt?
just "run opera"?
I know how to get to terminal, just not how to use half of it >.<
then try 'opera' then enter
alright, it just gave me an error
a long one?
ERROR: ld.so: object 'libjvm.so' from LD_PRELOAD cannot be preloaded: ignored.
yea, just a bit
and it used to work?
yes
although, it used to give me a weird error message whenever I ran it
looks like you hosed something on accident, any idea what you have been doing that would mess things up?
nothing I can think of, the only thing that I've done since then is mess with my gnome theme and try to find a package to make quicktime files play in firefox
have you installed java?
don't think so
find a package to make quicktime files play in firefox could maybe mess things up
both of those .so files are related to java
how so? I just used synaptic
k, so what should I do, try installing java to get those two files?
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats?action=show&redirect=Java
that has intructions to install java
maybe try reinstalling first
are you tehre?
yea
try reinstalling opera you mean?
yeah
how did you install it? did you get a .deb file?
yes
then from the command prompt you should be able to remove it with 'sudo dpkg -P name-of-package"
the name of t he package is probably just opera
kk
just reinstalled, still not working
you removed it and then installed it again?
no errors?
yes
then my only other recommendation besides installing java is to uninstall it again, and then install it with apt-get as explained in the wiki
I tried to install Blackdown Java from apt-get and it won't work
I don't konw what that it
thats the java version it has in the wiki, besides sun
the java you need is not listed because it's proprietary (unrestricted)
damnit the installation instructions are a bitch though >.<
yeah, they're pretty good
when you say you tried blakcdown java and it doesn't work does that mean opera doesn't work or blackdown?
blackdown java
to rename like Madpilot says, 'mv .opera .opera_old'
gives me an error when I tryed to apt-get it
so it wouldn't install?
yea
dependency?
try renaming your .opera file and see if that fixes it
trying to find it now
alright, I can't rename it, the option is unselectable. It's cause I'm not in root right?
or not running sudo
hmm it shouldn't be
did you try from a command line?
no
type 'ls -l opera' from the command line and tell me the permissions
...it says "no such file or directory"
gives me a realy long list of stuff
yeah just realized that. lets just try renaming it -- mv .opera .opera_old
alright, now what?
no errors? Then try running opera
you didn't have to 'sudo' it right?
no I didn
ran again, got the same error
opera again that is
should I just try and do java now? do you think that would solve my problem?
that means it is something wrong with the system. It's segmentation fault that is killing you, not necessarily the java errors
so what can I do about that?
k
what about my system problems?
good luck
k, thanks for all the help
not sure -- still just something affecting opera
keep trying here (I don't know that much)
k, I guess I'll figure it out eventually
you know more than I do
and use firefox until then?  :)
yea
guess I'll split to then
all it takes to learn what I know is to try to set up MythTV. Whew
